TextView.android:text:
The Department of I and PE was established in the year 1981. The Department has experienced and qualified staff. The courses offered have the right mix of Production and Industrial Engineering subjects. . Department is having CAD/CAM centre with CNC lathe, ROBOKIT, CAD solid works, solid edge, Catia, Fusion360 and statistical softwares. Department is having fully equipped Human Factors and ergonomics and Project and Research laboratories. Department is having audio visual centre. Apart from this, department is having 3 kW solar backup and also conducting solar power feasibility study. Department is having industry supported labs also. In addition to imparting technical and ethical knowledge to students, students are encouraged to conduct surveys, case studies to identify the community and industrial problems and to find the solutions. The Department is also having its own library with sufficient volumes and titles.
The Department was the first in the college to start a Research Centre with good enrolment of Research Scholars. So far department has produced 8 PhDs and many students are pursuing their research in product design, solar energy, CAPP and supply chain management.
The Department is conducting guest lectures by experts, Alumni and industry people, workshops, seminars etc regularly. Department is committed to outcome based education. The Alumni of the Department are working in various industries across the globe. Department is having MOU with the industries to help the students.
Studentsâ€™ chapters namely The Institution of Engineers (India) and Industrial Engineering and Operations Management Society International (Michigan) have been started in the department. Students are encouraged to conduct cultural, curricular and extracurricular activities.
To be a centre of excellence in education and research in the field of Industrial and Production engineering and known for its graduates serving industry and society.
M2: By adopting new teaching-learning process so as to expose the students in the field of design, manufacturing, management and computer applications to fulfill the needs of society.
M3: By strengthening industry institute interaction and with alumni for mutual benefits to exchange, knowledge, ideas and promote lifelong learning.
PEO1: To apply fundamental knowledge in mathematics, science and engineering concepts in Industrial and Production Engineering for the development of engineering system (Fundamental Knowledge).
PEO2: To analyze, plan, design manufacturing systems including process plan, quality assurance systems and process automation for real world problems (Skill).
PEO3: To exhibit team work and to practice professionally, ethically in various positions of industry or government and/or succeed in chosen field of higher education (Value and Professionalism).
PEO4: To practice lifelong learning towards successful career development and adopt to changing technological and societal needs (Career Development and Life-long Learning).
Name of the program: Industrial and Production Engineering

Admission to B.E. courses: The student should have passed 2nd PUC / 12th standard or equivalent examination with English as one of the languages and obtained 45% of marks in aggregate in Physics and Mathematics along with Chemistry / Bio-Technology / Computer Science / Electronics / Biology In case of candidates belonging to Karnataka Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe and other Backward Classes (Category I, 2A, 2B, 3A and 3B,) the minimum marks for the purpose of eligibility will be 40% of marks in aggregate in the optional subjects in the qualifying examination.
* Engineering knowledge: Apply the knowledge of mathematics, science, engineering fundamentals, and an engineering specialization to the solution of complex engineering problems.

* Problem analysis: Identify, formulate, review research literature, and analyze complex engineering problems reaching substantiated conclusions using first principles of mathematics, natural sciences, and engineering sciences.

* Design/development of solutions: Design solutions for complex engineering problems and design system components or processes that meet the specified needs with appropriate consideration for the public health and safety, and the cultural, societal, and environmental considerations.

* Conduct investigations of complex problems: Use research-based knowledge and research methods including design of experiments, analysis and interpretation of data, and synthesis of the information to provide valid conclusions.

* Modern tool usage: Create, select, and apply appropriate techniques, resources, and modern engineering and IT tools including prediction and modelling to complex engineering activities with an understanding of the limitations.

* The engineer and society: Apply reasoning informed by the contextual knowledge to assess societal, health, safety, legal and cultural issues and the consequent responsibilities relevant to the professional engineering practice.

* Environment and sustainability: Understand the impact of the professional engineering solutions in societal and environmental contexts, and demonstrate the knowledge of, and need for sustainable development.
* Ethics: Apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics and responsibilities and norms of the engineering practice.
* Individual and team work: Function effectively as an individual, and as a member or leader in diverse teams, and in multidisciplinary settings.

* Communication: Communicate effectively on complex engineering activities with the engineering community and with society at large, such as, being able to comprehend and write effective reports and design documentation, make effective presentations, and give and receive clear instructions.

* Project management and finance: Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the engineering and management principles and apply these to oneâ€™s own work, as a member and leader in a team, to manage projects and in multidisciplinary environments.
* Life-long learning: Recognize the need for, and have the preparation and ability to engage in independent and life-long learning in the broadest context of technological change.

* BE Industrial and Production Engineering graduates at PDA College of Engineering will be able to:
PSO1. Apply the knowledge of Industrial and Production Engineering to analyze and solve problems in complex manufacturing and service systems with social relevance.
PSO2. Plan, including methods, design, process plan, quality assurance systems and process automation to develop manufacturing systems with emphasis on industrial safety.
PSO3. Engage in lifelong learning, career enhancement and adopt to changing technological, professional and societal needs
Program Title - Industrial and Production Engineering
Curriculum Owner / Program Owner Name - Dr. S. S. Kalshetty
Road Map Of Industrial And Production Engineering Department

Development of Ergonomics and Human Factor Engineering Laboratory and Research center
Developing strong alumni base
MOU with both Industry and Premier Institutions to expose the students to industrial and research field. This will also enhance the placement

To get patents for the research work and product development
To introduce integrated MBA (four years B.E. + one year MBA)
To introduce PG program in Product Design and Computer Integrated Manufacturing

Department of Industrial and Production Engineering
P D A College of Engineering, Kalaburagi

Dr.Shashidhar Kalashetty Professor and Head of the Department is also Chairman Board of Studies of I and PE discipline and Member of Board of Governing Body (BoG) of the College. He did his PhD from VTU Belgravia in Product design, M.Tech from IIT Kharagpur in Production Science Technology and B.E. from Gulbarga University Gulbarga in Mechanical Engineering. His field of interests are Product design, Ergonomics, Farm Machines and Production. He has taken up a research work on design and development of a user friendly pesticide sprayer based on the customersâ€™ requirements. The objective of this research work is to provide a cost effective user friendly sprayer which will help the pigeon pea grower for which Gulbarga is popular. He has been involving UG students in this research work and produced many working prototypes as final year projects and tested in the field. Based on the test data, incremental changes are made. Presently he is involved in design and development of solar sprayer and vehicle. He has put up 32 years of teaching experience and guiding 7 PhD students and has published many technical papers in International journals and Coferences.
Department has VTU recognized research centre under faculty of Industrial and Production engineering.
Department has adequate research facilities in the form of state of the art research facilities and reference material to cater to the needs of research students.
There are seven doctorate faculty in the department to takeup/guide any research work.
There a quite good number of research scholars registered for Ph.D. under doctorate faculty of our department under variuos areas.

Industrial and Production Department is situated on the first floor and having neat, tidy and well ventilated faculty rooms, seminar and class rooms, RO drinking water toilets for faculty, staff, girls and boys. Class rooms and laboratories are provided with LED projectors.In addition to adequate central facilities like machine shop, work shop, material science and instrumentation and metrology lab, the department is having its own well equipped, neat and tidy laboratories- Advance manufacturing and Computer Application lab, Human factors and ergonomics lab and Project and Research lab and Industry Supported Lab.
Details of the facilities available in the department laboratories are given in the following tables
UG Pre-final and final year students
3 kW Solar power generation and analyzing equipment

Maximum Power Point Tracker (MPPT)
solar charge controller
Semi-flexible solar panels of deferent ratings
Digital Multi meter With data logger
